title: Kubernetes Cluster Autoscaler Overview
description:
This dashboard provides insights into your Kubernetes Cluster Autoscaler.
You can use this dashbaord to check the cluster autoscaler state and resource consumption.
You can also use it to check for downsacaling and upscaling.

definition.content:
# Kubernetes Cluster Autoscaler

This dashboard provides an overview of your Kubernetes Cluster Autoscaler metrics describing its own operations as well as some metrics related to general state of the cluster.
It monitors Cluster state, execution, operations and Node Autoprovisioning operations.

**Useful Links**
- [Kubernetes Cluster Autoscaler Integration doc](https://docs.datadoghq.com/integrations/kubernetes_kubernetes_cluster_autoscaler/?tab=host)
- [Kubernetes Cluster Autoscaler metrics list](https://github.com/kubernetes/autoscaler/blob/master/cluster-autoscaler/proposals/metrics.md)

The service checks show the Kubernetes Cluster Autoscaler OpenMetrics endpoint status.

The monitor summary shows you any active alerts for the most crucial Metrics.
The Cluster used resources such as cpu and memory vs the allocated (limit) ressources.

definition.title: CPU Percentage Usage (current cores vs limit)
Memory Percentage Usage (current bytes vs limit)

definition.content: The number of nodes removed by the cluster autoscaler.
The cluster state indicates whether the cluster is healthy enough for autoscaling, along with the number of managed nodes groups and the nodes count.

markers.label: cluster autoscaler is stuck down here (value should be 1)

definition.content: The record of the last time certain part of cluster autoscaler logic executed and time taken by different functions executed in main Cluster Autoscaler goroutine.

definition.title: Memory Percentage Usage (current bytes vs limit)
Last Time the cluster autoscaler logic executed

definition.content: The number of nodes successfully added by the cluster autoscaler, and the number of unsuccessful scale-up operations.
